In the past, there were four brahmin sages who diligently cultivated good dharmas and attained the five supernormal powers, but were always afraid of death.
At that time, the four brahmin sages, having diligently cultivated good dharmas and attained the five supernormal powers, then thought:
'Where should we stay to remain in the world forever?'

At that time, one of the brahmins, having diligently cultivated good dharmas and possessing great spiritual powers and the five supernormal abilities, then entered the sky, thinking, 'In the sky, there is no death.'
The one who entered the sky then lost his life.
The second brahmin, having diligently cultivated good dharmas and the five supernormal powers, afraid of death, then entered the great ocean, thinking, 'In the ocean, I will not die.'
He then died in the ocean.
The third brahmin, who diligently practiced good dharmas and had great power and the five supernormal knowledges, fearing death, entered the mountain's interior and died there.
The fourth brahmin, who diligently practiced good dharmas and had the five supernormal knowledges and great power, fearing death, entered the ground, thinking, I will escape death there.
